title: Carpenter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: they do not know what their doing nor do they follow modern rules of safety which is very hard to believe Wish I never wasted my time going to an interview
Interview Questions: do I know lock out procedure

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS)
Interview Descriptions: Interviews progressed quickly and everyone involved treated me well and with respect. I had initial questions about the total compensation that I’d asked HR early on (before the interviews) which they did not answer. This ended up being an important factor for me and regrettably, I later withdrew from the process when I learned the answers to my questions and that my needs couldn’t be met. Learning this earlier would have saved everyone time and effort.
Interview Questions: The questions were all behavioural based and relevant to the role.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quite positive. It is mainly related to your future study plan and work plan. Professors care more about your future free time and energy than they do about the professional level.
Interview Questions:
1. Introduce yourself .
2. Describe one time you faced difficult.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: the process started with a phone call for pre-screening with the HR personnel to review my resume. Then I was invited for another interview with a hiring panel consisting of 3 persons.
Interview Questions: examples of my previous experience in managing IT projects and related challenges and how these challenges have been solved.

title: RSO Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 interviewers. The interview lasted around 30 min. Consisted of basic questions, nothing you could not handle such as "how would you handle a call about a noise complaint late at night?". Make sure your answers clearly show that you understand what the job is about.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest accomplishment so far?

title: RSO Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: In person interview. Sat down in a classroom and was asked a couple of questions by 2 interviewers. lasted about 30 min. Talk as much as you can. Make sure to answer all questions, do not take too long to think. Body language important
Interview Questions: why should we hire you

title: Welcome Desk Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I asked a friend to give me a reference then he gave me the manager's email, then I got it after talking to the manager, it's just a temporary job, so nothing really complicated, any student can get it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Residence Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Group interview followed by individual interview. Lots of team building activities. All very relevant to the position. Individual interview was with potential boss and senior employee. Process took a month to do.
Interview Questions: Personal questions and decision making

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was no formal interview process. I first asked for the position and was told that they'd let me know if there was an opening. I was then asked if I wanted the position and I accepted.
Interview Questions: No questions were required other than a driver's licence for field trip opportunities where I was required to drive students

title: Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Very standard process as one could imagine for an institution this size. The HR people were professional, friendly, accommodating and direct.  Throughout the process they kept me informed and were pleasant to deal with. The interview panel definitely knew their stuff when asking questions. If you put something on your resume, they will have experts on the panel able to determine if you actually know what you claim to know.
Interview Questions: A lot of excel questions about formulas, pivot tables and various other advanced features.

title: System Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was quite basic, they are not looking for technical person, moreover they look for behaviour point of view and similarities in the env you have worked in past.
Very smooth process, salary is bit low
Interview Questions:
basic question on area of linux, administration
sql queries, 
webserver troubleshooting

title: Bartender Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: asked about former work and volunteer experience... very standard interview that you would face for a job in the service industry. wasn't super intimidating either. I thought they asked questions based on personality and on my previous jobs, and allowed me to feel comfortable
Interview Questions: previous work experience

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by HR and your hiring manager. A lot of situational questions.They will asking about your strengths and weaknesses. They will also ask about a time when you deescalated a difficult situation and helped a customer.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was : What are some unique differences between Dal and SMU

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: A quick selection process depending on your grades/qualifications on your resume. If you have exceptional grades then it makes it easier for you to get contacted by the program director/supervisor for this opportunity. Usually you need to send out an email to know if there are any available opportunities.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Helpdesk Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Conversation with your immediate supervisor followed by a test/exam to gauge your knowledge of technology and familiarity with SMU infrastructure.
Then you meet with the department head but basically as a formality
Interview Questions: Describe one instance of you dealing with a technical issue

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS)
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. If you get good enough marks the professors/TA coordinators will email you asking if you'd be interested in becoming a TA. Once that happens, you have to fill out an application, submit a cover letter, resume, and transcripts then wait for approval. No interview needed.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a TA?

title: Residence Service Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted the resume and references online. Got a call to setup an interview through google doc sheet. There was a group interview as first where you have to deal with a situation in a group and later an individual interview will be scheduled if you cold pass the group interview.
Interview Questions: Mostly situational questions. Based on customer service and security

title: Registraion Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straight forward, you have the interview with the HR representative and the Manager of the department for the job you applied to. Simple interview questions and also a lot of situational questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your self in 5 years from now?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Unprofessional setting, and people who conducted the interview.  They asked inappropriate questions.  It took a long period of time before hearing back from the interviewer.  This made it difficult to determine if I wanted to even work for them.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this role

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired by personal contact through the prof. There was no formal interview as the professor used his classes to determine who would be allowed to work for him. A high mark was not required but a willingness to work and learn
Interview Questions: N/A

title: English Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Saint Mary's University (Canada) (Halifax, NS) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Was about 1 hour long with the Department Director and Director of Academic studies. Pretty standard questions - strengths/weaknesses, most proud of, etc and some more 'technical' questions on English language and teaching methodology.
Was fairly intense and left with a feeling of 50/50 about getting the position, but heard back with a positive response within 10 days.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths/weaknesses? Give an example of how you solved a problem between students in the classroom.
